wikipedia_page.main: General Lord William Frederick Ernest Seymour  (8 December 1838 – 9 February 1915), known as William Seymour until 1871, was a senior British Army officer.

response: In March 1811 Seymour married Georgiana Mary Berkeley (a daughter of Sir George Berkeley) and they had three sons (Francis Seymour, 5th Marquess of Hertford, Vice-Admiral Henry Seymour and General Lord William Seymour) and four daughters (including Laura Williamina Seymour).

The incident received significant coverage.  In Halifax, on Arbor Day, 8 May 1899, the teachers and pupils of Morris Street School, Keatings alma-mater, planted a tree in his memory in the Halifax Public Gardens.  General Lord William Seymour, commanding the British troops, gave an address. An easel was set up in front of the tree bearing pictures of both Queen Victoria and Keating, the whole draped in the Leinsters' colours.Acadian Recorder, 8 May 1899.  The Herald headline declared "Planted a Tree for Halifax Hero".9 May 1899.   In 1925, a marker was installed at the tree.Bernard, p. 55
Lord William Seymour may refer to:
*Lord William Seymour (MP) (1759–1837), MP for Coventry, Downton, and Orford
*Lord William Seymour (British Army officer) (1838–1915), British general
